summary: This memorandum details allegations of a CIA connection involving Laureano BATISTA and Rudolph Richard DAVIS, focusing on Cuban exile activities, potential training camps, and their involvement with anti-CASTRO organizations. It also summarizes OS indices results, highlighting BATISTA's prior relationship with the Agency.
summary_one_paragraph: This SECRET memorandum, dated December 13, 1967, addresses allegations of a CIA connection between Laureano BATISTA, Secretary of Military Affairs for the Movimiento Democratica Cristiano (MDC), and Rudolph Richard DAVIS, a Cuban exile. DAVIS claimed that BATISTA sent 19 men from Miami to a training camp near Lacombe, Louisiana, in 1963. The memo indicates that BATISTA was granted Provisional Operational Approval in December 1959 and Operational Approval in February 1960 for use as a PP agent in Havana, Cuba. Furthermore, the Hungarian Freedom Fighters, an Agency-sponsored group, expressed interest in the MDC, leading Covert Action Staff to investigate the MDC before approving contact between the two organizations.
title: BATISTA, Laureano
